p: Larval mortality in exposed L. botrana individuals was directly proportional to C. acaulis EO and C. acaulis-based NE concentrations ( F 6,23 = 40.47, p < 0.0001; F 5,23 = 27.22, p < 0.0001, respectively); significant larvicidal activity was observed starting from 2.5 µL/mL of EO and 8.0 µL/mL of NE. Comparable concentrations of C. acaulis EO showed higher larvicidal activity over the C. acaulis EO NE. As reported in Table 2, 50% of larval mortality was achieved testing a concentration equal to 7.29 ± 0.25 µL/mL of C. acaulis EO and 9.04 ± 0.39 µL/mL of C. acaulis NE. Besides, the LC 90 of C. acaulis EO was lower than that of C. acaulis-based NE (10.92 ± 1.40 µL/mL and 17.70 ± 4.48 µL/mL, respectively); 100% larval mortality was achieved with the positive control represented by a semi-synthetic diet treated with the positive control spinosad (Laser ®) at the label dose (i.e., 150 ppm).
